w:r.w:t: by using TPR, sentence frames, and vocabulary. Students will study these words and phrases:
rules, home, school, law, stealing, speeding, home, school, community,
I clean my room, I do my homework,
eat together, We share, I raise my hand, No running, no stealing, no speeding, stop at a red light
n of this lesson, students will be able to:
sets of words in complete sentences

-branded opener slide that the teacher will display as the student enters the classroom.

and explain that we will be learning about rules!
Complete the sentence frame with the correct word:
Circle the first picture and read it. Explain that they are playing nice and not fighting.
Circle the second picture and read it. Explain that they are playing safe and the right way.
And have the child repeat. Explain that a rule is something we HAVE to do. Circle the pictures again. Ask the child if the children are at home or at school.
Complete the sentence frame with the correct word:
in the white space and have the child repeat.
Clear the screen and draw a picture of your home and say
Clear the screen and the child to draw their home.
. Then circle the next picture and say,
Circle the family and emphasize the fact that they are all together, mom, dad, sister, brother and baby.
Have the child repeat the phrase.
. Then circle the next picture and say,
Circle the boy sweeping and emphasize the fact that he is cleaning. Remind the student that we have to clean our room at home, it is a rule.
Have the child repeat the phrase.
. Then circle the next picture and say,
Circle the boy working and emphasize the fact that he is at his house (circle the lamp) and he is doing his work from school.
Have the child repeat the phrase.
Say all the rules at home in a complete phrase (
home I clean my room, At home I do my homework)
while first circling the house and the first picture. Encourage the child to say the other two in complete sentences.
Explain that these are three rules we have at home by holding
up three fingers and circling the house.

in the white space and have the child repeat.

Clear the screen and the child to draw their school.

Have the child repeat the phrase.

Have the child repeat the phrase.
Draw one rule we follow in school
Circle the school and ask, “What is one rule we have at school.” The child should draw a picture of sharing, raising your hand or not running.
Complete the sentence frame with the correct word:
Circle the first picture and say,
Have the child repeat. Explain that a law is something we HAVE to do in the community. Then circle the picture of the community.
Complete the sentence frame with the correct word:
Circle the picture and explain what he is doing. Explain that he is stealing, taking something that is not his.
Simply explain that stealing is against the law.
Circle the red light and explain that red means stop, and put your hand up to show the action for stop.
Circle the car, the exhaust and the man’s scarf. Explain that he was going fast and do the action for fast.
Tell the three laws that we learned in this lesson (
no speeding, stop at a red light, no stealing)
Circle on the of the three pictures at the bottom of the slid and encourage the child to say the law learned in the lesson.
Draw (or draw a line) from the rule or law to the correct column.
Say the name of each rule or law.
Review the five pictures with the student. Have the child say the name of each picture. Circle the first picture. Ask the child,
Is this a rule or a law?
and drag the picture to the correct column. Do the same with all the pictures.

Word Wall Vocabulary Builder Activity – Slide 22
Students will read and spell their new words:
rules, home, school, law, stealing, speeding
Teacher will give feedback on the spelling and pronunciation of the new words.
